sentences.en: A gentleman should always be civil, even to his inferiors.
sentences.cn: 绅士应该总是彬彬有礼,即便是对地位不及自己者.

sentences.en: Civil disobedience, violent or non-violent, is intentional law breaking.
sentences.cn: 公民抗命，不管是暴力还是非暴力的，都是故意犯法。

sentences.en: Civil war in the Sudan has been grinding on for nine years.
sentences.cn: 苏丹内战已经持续了9年之久。

sentences.en: civil war/disturbance/unrest etc (=fighting etc between different groups of people living in the same country)
civil war/disturbance/unrest etc (=fighting etc between different groups of people living in the same country).
Ethnic tensions among the republics could lead to civil war.
sentences.cn: 共和国之间紧张的种族关系可能会引发内战。

sentences.en: He acknowledged the sense of betrayal by civil rights leaders.
sentences.cn: 他承认自己有被民权领袖出卖了的感觉。

sentences.en: The Channel Tunnel project is the biggest civil engineering project in Europe.
sentences.cn: 英吉利海峡隧道是欧洲最大的土木工程。

sentences.en: The civil aviation minister ordered all the planes to be grounded.
sentences.cn: 民航部长下令所有飞机不得起飞。

sentences.en: The civil war is obstructing distribution of famine relief by aid agencies.
sentences.cn: 内战阻碍着救援机构对饥荒赈济物资的配给。

sentences.en: The parliament in Madrid was taken over by civil guards.
sentences.cn: 马德里议会大厦被国民警卫队接管了。

sentences.en: The real danger is civil unrest in the east of the country.
sentences.cn: 真正的危险是该国东部地区的民众动乱。

sentences.en: The years of civil war have dehumanized all of us.
sentences.cn: 连年内战剥夺了我们所有人的人性。

sentences.en: There are other forms of civil disorder — most notably, football hooliganism.
sentences.cn: 还有其他形式的民众骚乱，最出名的是足球流氓行为。

sentences.en: They have purged thousands from the upper levels of the civil service.
sentences.cn: 他们从上层文职部门清除了上千名公务员。

sentences.en: They were married in a civil ceremony in May.
sentences.cn: 他们在五月份举行了世俗婚礼。

sentences.en: They were married on August 9 in a civil ceremony in Venice.
sentences.cn: 他们于8月9号在威尼斯举行了世俗婚礼。

sentences.en: This form of civil disobedience isn't a particularly new phenomenon.
sentences.cn: 这种形式的非暴力反抗并不是特别新的现象。

words.tran_cn: 教化；使…文明；启发（civilize的过去分词）

phrases.tran_cn: 民事诉讼；民事诉讼法；民事诉讼程序

trans.tran_cn: 国民的，民用的，政府的，民事的，斯文的，有礼貌的，客气的
trans.tran_en: relating to the people who live in a country
